title: Hotel companies go big on leisure and pilgrim towns as travel booms
description: The share of hotel rooms in the tier-II and tier-III cities increased to 38% of the total inventory at the end of 2022 from 33% four years ago according to a recent HVS-Anarock report. The share of hotel rooms in metros reduced to 19% from 30% during the period. Cities such as Agra, Haridwar, Manali, McLeod Ganj, Kasauli, Katra, Mahabaleshwar, and Vrindavan reported the opening of new hotels in the mid-market and upscale segments.
